result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce D Ripley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations or comply with current assessment if done in the past 6 months.

No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. 
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting.

Must follow rules of supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$275.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

Allpaid Confirmation received for $200

3:00 p.m. Defendant Bruce D Ripley in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Bruce D Ripley.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk. 
Count 1-AMENDED to poss amphetamine 961.41(3g)(d) PTAC, misd-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 3-poss para-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Counts 2/4-DRI

SENTENCE: 
Count 1-w/h, probation up to 1 yr. AODA or comply w/ assmt done in the past 6 mo. No controlled substances. No contact w/ users/dealers. Must follow rules of supervision. 5 days credit. 
DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $275.05 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. Must report to probation today.

Count 3-w/h, probation up to 1 yr. AODA or comply w/ assmt done in the past 6 mo. No controlled substances. No contact w/ users/dealers. Must follow rules of supervision. 5 days credit. 
DNA sample, $200 surcharge, No fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. Must report to probation today.
